title: Wallop's Targeting Indicator is inaccurate by design
body:
Whenever I play Gnar, aiming his Mega W feels off. The targeting indicator is shaped like any normal skill shot indicator, yet its displayed effective radius doesn't match up with it. The displayed effective radius is a rectangle extending from Mega Gnar, not a normal skill shot. I've tried to describe this before to people, but without pictures it was difficult. So I actually learned how to take screenshots in-game to show the difference; and it's a major one, I think.

Granted my aim is a bit off so they might be misaligned, but look at these pictures and just try to tell me that Wallop's targeting indicator matches up with its effective radius. The indicator can fit in the actual radius.

Could Wallop get a new targeting indicator? I know there are rectangular indicators in the game (Lucian's Q is what I have in mind), so can Mega Gnar get the same thing? It doesn't feel right when you narrowly miss an enemy or stun them when you outright shouldn't.

Edit: Overlapping Image supplied by Alopex
http://apollo-na-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/1439304757/GnarComparison.jpg

replies.body:
Meddler pointed me over here. You've got a good point.  I know Lux's R uses a rectangular indicator so maybe I could borrow something like that...

I'll take a look today.  No guarantees, but may be able to improve it.

As a side note, many of our arrow/rectangle cast indicators (the ones only the caster can see) are slightly shorter and skinnier than the actual effects they represent.  This can account for things like travel time and makes the spells feel more accurate overall.

As an example, Jinx's W has 1500 range but the indicator is 1450 units long.  This means you're less likely to use it on running targets who are at exactly the max range as they'll be slightly outside the indicator.  This is good because when you take cast and travel time into account you were never going to hit that guy anyway.
Jinx's Zap is also slightly thicker then the animation portrays, as well as Tahm Kench's Tongue Lash. It's a pretty annoying and misconceiving thing to dodge from time to time.
It's also pretty annoying for the tahm player when tongue lash gets bodyblocked by things that are _behind_ you
wat.
Tongue lash's hitbox is so large that it can hit units in the opposite direction of where you aimed it

That has to do with where the hitbox *starts* more than its size. Most of Vel'Koz's abilities originate in front of his face rather than inside of his model, which is what made playing against Akali such a pain in the ass back when her Ult still put her squarely on top of whoever she targeted. The logic with Tahm is probably that his tongue is inside his mouth, therefore... it can hit things underneath him...?

This is good because when you take cast and travel time into account you were never going to hit that guy anyway.

I think the difference here is that Wallop is an instant AoE effect (so there isn't travel time, just a cast time) and Jinx's W is a projectile with both a cast time and travel time, while being at a significantly longer range that makes projectile speed a lot more relevant to how it feels to use. Mega Gnar's W and Lux's ult are both the same kind of ability in terms of cast delay-instant AoE damage, and while the reduced range indicator size makes it feel better with the cast time included, it is just a bit too small relative to the size of the AoE. Sion's Q is also similar, and has a similarly undersized cast indicator, but it is much closer in size to the actual ability effect, so having it be a touch small is ok, just not this much smaller.

Thanks.

Yo, Gypsy. Has any work been done on this? I notice on the PBE, Azir is getting a update to his ultimate's targeting reticle, but Gnar's nowhere in sight.

I personally dont use indicators anymore except on a few key champs, or to turn it on on a new champ to see how long their dash or whatever is. What i would like to see fixed is quick cast with indicators. Its nice, and i thought the idea was to be quick cast, but sometimes you can hold it for an indicator, but instead it seems to be you HAVE to see the indicator before it launches, causing a few abilities to not go off unless you spam the key, which can really mess you up.

could we just get rid of all the little arrows except in the specific circumstances they work best in?  i dont want to just see a little stubby arrow on sejuani's q, or on dravens ult.  for global ults id like to see a lux ult-like indicator, where it just shows it in a line all the way down to where it would go.  as for the sejuani q, i really dont understand why this is even the case

the majority of them aren't even accurate lol, lee's q goes WAY farther than the arrow indicates. and also flash has such a small circle it's funny you can flash over big ass walls. i don't mind it though you get used to it pretty quickly, at least i did

Flash (and most other TP's) are special in that they "cheat" walls.  If you could go over half the wall, it takes you over the whole thing.  In this case the indicator is representative of the majority of cases ( like when you flash in lane).

flash has such a small circle it's funny you can flash over big ass walls. i don't mind it though you get used to it pretty quickly, at least i did

This is a special case to be honest. Most dashes and teleports work in a way that allow to get over to other side of walls if you reach at least halfway.
